item.title: Alma add a quote by Winston Spencer-Churchill
item.description: "In the course of my life, I have often had to eat my words, and I must confess that I have always found it a wholesome diet." -- Winston Spencer-Churchill

item.title: Alma add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "The truth is incontrovertible. Malice may attack it, ignorance may deride it, but in the end, there it is." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Alma add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Alma add a quote by Zelda Fitzgerald
item.description: "Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold." -- Zelda Fitzgerald

item.title: Alma add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A celebrity is any well-known TV or movie star who looks like he spends more than two hours working on his hair." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Alma add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "The future for me is already a thing of the past - You were my first love and you will be my last" -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Alma add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Alma add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Be sure you put your feet in the right place, then stand firm." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Alma add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I do not think much of a man who is not wiser today than he was yesterday." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Alma add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I am not bound to win, but I am bound to be true. I am not bound to succeed, but I am bound to live up to what light I have." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Alma add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Alma add a quote by Muhammad Ali
item.description: "If they can make penicillin out of moldy bread, then they can sure make something out of you." -- Muhammad Ali

item.title: Alma add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Alma add a quote by mahatma gandhi
item.description: "I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet." -- mahatma gandhi

item.title: Alma add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Alma add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is like an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Alma add a quote by Jerry Seinfeld
item.description: "You know the message you're sending out to the world with these sweatpants? You're telling the world, 'I give up. I can't compete in normal society. I'm miserable, so I might as well be comfortable." -- Jerry Seinfeld

item.title: Alma add a quote by Golda Meir
item.description: "Don't be so humble - you are not that great." -- Golda Meir

item.title: Alma add a quote by Duke Ellington
item.description: "Love is supreme and unconditional. Like is nice, but limited." -- Duke Ellington
